description: Drill down to root causes by asking 'why' iteratively. Each answer becomes the basis for the next question. Particularly effective for problem analysis and understanding system failures.
output_pattern: problem → why1 → why2 → why3 → why4 → why5 → root cause

description: Break down complex problems into fundamental truths and rebuild from there. Question assumptions and reconstruct understanding from basic principles.
output_pattern: assumptions → deconstruction → fundamentals → reconstruction → solution

description: Evaluate internal and external factors through Strengths Weaknesses Opportunities and Threats. Provides balanced strategic perspective.
output_pattern: strengths → weaknesses → opportunities → threats → strategic insights

description: Create visual representations of interconnected concepts branching from central idea. Reveals relationships and patterns not immediately obvious.
output_pattern: central concept → primary branches → secondary branches → connections → insights

description: Imagine project has failed and work backwards to identify potential failure points. Proactive risk identification through hypothetical failure scenarios.
output_pattern: future failure → contributing factors → warning signs → preventive measures

description: Evaluate risks by probability and impact to prioritize mitigation efforts. Visual framework for systematic risk assessment.
output_pattern: risk identification → probability assessment → impact analysis → prioritization → mitigation

description: Systematic creative thinking through Substitute Combine Adapt Modify Put to other uses Eliminate Reverse. Generates innovative alternatives.
output_pattern: substitute → combine → adapt → modify → other uses → eliminate → reverse

description: Explore topic from six perspectives: facts (white) emotions (red) caution (black) optimism (yellow) creativity (green) process (blue).
output_pattern: facts → emotions → risks → benefits → alternatives → synthesis

description: Systematic investigation to identify fundamental causes rather than symptoms. Uses various techniques to drill down to core issues.
output_pattern: symptoms → immediate causes → intermediate causes → root causes → solutions

description: Visual cause-and-effect analysis organizing potential causes into categories. Also known as Ishikawa diagram for systematic problem analysis.
output_pattern: problem statement → major categories → potential causes → sub-causes → prioritization

description: Examine Political Economic Social Technological Legal Environmental factors. Comprehensive external environment assessment.
output_pattern: political → economic → social → technological → legal → environmental → implications

description: Examine activities that create value from raw materials to end customer. Identifies competitive advantages and improvement opportunities.
output_pattern: primary activities → support activities → linkages → value creation → optimization

description: Visualize end-to-end experience identifying touchpoints pain points and opportunities. Understanding through customer or user perspective.
output_pattern: stages → touchpoints → actions → emotions → pain points → opportunities

description: Map service delivery showing frontstage backstage and support processes. Reveals service complexity and improvement areas.
output_pattern: customer actions → frontstage → backstage → support processes → improvement areas

description: Identify and analyze stakeholders by interest and influence. Strategic approach to stakeholder engagement.
output_pattern: identification → interest analysis → influence assessment → engagement strategy

description: Understand stakeholder perspectives through what they think feel see say do. Deep understanding of user needs and motivations.
output_pattern: thinks → feels → sees → says → does → pains → gains

description: Evaluate options against weighted criteria for objective decision making. Systematic comparison of alternatives.
output_pattern: criteria definition → weighting → scoring → calculation → ranking → selection

description: Compare costs against benefits to evaluate decision viability. Quantitative approach to decision validation.
output_pattern: cost identification → benefit identification → quantification → comparison → recommendation

description: Challenge assumptions and proposals by arguing opposing viewpoint. Stress-testing through deliberate opposition.
output_pattern: proposal → counter-arguments → weaknesses → blind spots → strengthened proposal

description: Simulate adversarial perspective to identify vulnerabilities. Security and robustness through adversarial thinking.
output_pattern: current approach → adversarial view → attack vectors → vulnerabilities → countermeasures
